segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine, and we're talking about the stars today.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们要谈论星星。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Today we're going to talk about a very popular subject many people believe in the horoscope.
segments.cn: 今天我们要讨论一个很多人相信的热门话题：星座。

segments.en: So a horoscope is basically a system, a very old system, of determining your future and describing your personality.
segments.cn: 星座基本上是一个非常古老的系统，用来预测未来和描述个性。

segments.en: And so it all depends on when you were born and where you were born.
segments.cn: 这完全取决于你出生的时间和地点。

segments.en: So what stars were in the sky when you were born.
segments.cn: 也就是你出生时天空中的星星。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So basically, as many of you may know, there are 12 signs.
segments.cn: 基本上，正如你们许多人所知，有12个星座。

segments.en: And we're going to talk about a couple of them and a little bit more about horoscopes and this... I don't know, I guess it's kind of like a branch of science?
segments.cn: 我们将讨论其中几个，以及更多关于星座的内容……我不知道，我想这算是一种科学的分支吗？

segments.en: Yeah, pseudoscience.
segments.cn: 是的，伪科学。

segments.en: Pseudoscience.
segments.cn: 伪科学。

segments.en: Yeah, I don't think there's much testing that's going on, but it's definitely something that a lot of people believe in.
segments.cn: 是的，我认为没有太多测试在进行，但这绝对是很多人相信的东西。

segments.en: So let's take a listen to today's dialogue, and we'll be back in a moment to talk more about it.
segments.cn: 那么让我们来听听今天的对话，稍后我们会回来讨论更多内容。

segments.en: Hey, Lydia, what are you reading?
segments.cn: 嘿，Lydia，你在读什么？

segments.en: I'm looking at my horoscope for this month.
segments.cn: 我在看这个月的星座运势。

segments.en: My outlook is very positive.
segments.cn: 我的运势非常积极。

segments.en: It says that I should take a vacation to someplace exotic and that I will have a passionate summer fling.
segments.cn: 说我应该去一个异国度假，并且会有一个热情的夏季恋情。

segments.en: What are you talking about?
segments.cn: 你在说什么？

segments.en: Let me see that.
segments.cn: 让我看看。

segments.en: What are horoscopes?
segments.cn: 星座是什么？

segments.en: It's a prediction of your month based on your zodiac sign.
segments.cn: 这是根据你的星座对你这个月的预测。

segments.en: You have a different sign for the month and date you were born in.
segments.cn: 你有一个不同的星座，取决于你出生的月份和日期。

segments.en: I was born on April 15.
segments.cn: 我是4月15日出生的。

segments.en: So I'm an Aries.
segments.cn: 所以我是白羊座。

segments.en: When were you born?
segments.cn: 你什么时候出生的？

segments.en: January 5.
segments.cn: 1月5日。

segments.en: Let's see, you're a Capricorn.
segments.cn: 让我看看，你是摩羯座。

segments.en: It says that you'll be feeling stress at work, but you could see new exciting developments in your love life.
segments.cn: 说你在工作中会感到压力，但你的爱情生活会有新的激动人心的发展。

segments.en: Looks like we'll both have interesting summers.
segments.cn: 看来我们两个的夏天都会很有趣。

segments.en: That's bogus.
segments.cn: 这太荒谬了。

segments.en: I don't feel any stress at work and my love life is practically non-existent.
segments.cn: 我在工作中没有感到任何压力，我的爱情生活几乎不存在。

segments.en: This zodiac stuff is all a bunch of nonsense.
segments.cn: 这些星座的东西都是一堆胡说八道。

segments.en: No it's not.
segments.cn: 不是的。

segments.en: Your astrology sign can tell you a lot about your personality.
segments.cn: 你的星座可以告诉你很多关于你个性的信息。

segments.en: See, it says that an Aries is energetic and loves to socialize.
segments.cn: 看，它说白羊座是充满活力并且喜欢社交的。

segments.en: Well you certainly match those criteria, but they're so broad they could apply to anyone.
segments.cn: 嗯，你确实符合这些标准，但它们太宽泛了，适用于任何人。

segments.en: What does it say about me?
segments.cn: 那它对我说了什么？

segments.en: A Capricorn is serious minded and practical.
segments.cn: 摩羯座是严肃和务实的。

segments.en: She likes to do things in conventional ways.
segments.cn: 她喜欢以传统的方式做事。

segments.en: That sounds just like you.
segments.cn: 听起来就像你。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So a very interesting dialogue between these two girls talking about one of them believing in the horoscope and the other one doesn't.
segments.cn: 这是两个女孩之间非常有趣的对话，一个相信星座，另一个不相信。

segments.en: But they mentioned a lot of interesting things, so we're going to have two language takeaways today.
segments.cn: 但他们提到了很多有趣的事情，所以今天我们将有两个语言要点。

segments.en: Let's start with language takeaway part one.
segments.cn: 让我们开始第一部分的语言要点。

segments.en: Language takeaway Alright, so one of the most common things you'll hear when we talk about the horoscope in English is an outlook.
segments.cn: 语言要点 好吧，当我们谈论星座时，你最常听到的事情之一就是运势。

segments.en: And an outlook can be positive or negative.
segments.cn: 运势可以是积极的或消极的。

segments.en: So what exactly is an outlook?
segments.cn: 那么运势到底是什么？

segments.en: Well, if you notice Lydia said, my outlook is very positive.
segments.cn: 嗯，如果你注意到Lydia说，我的运势非常积极。

segments.en: So basically she's talking about her future.
segments.cn: 所以基本上她在谈论她的未来。

segments.en: So the way that she sees the future or the way that the horoscope talks about the future is a positive one.
segments.cn: 她对未来的看法或星座对未来的描述是积极的。

segments.en: So you could say, you know those eight balls?
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，你知道那些八球吗？

segments.en: They're black and they have like a message and you shake it and it gives you a message?
segments.cn: 它们是黑色的，上面有信息，你摇动它，它会给你一个信息？

segments.en: You ask a question.
segments.cn: 你问一个问题。

segments.en: You ask a question and it says outlook positive.
segments.cn: 你问一个问题，它说运势积极。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Things will either be positive or negative.
segments.cn: 事情要么是积极的，要么是消极的。

segments.en: So I guess you can apply it, for example, to a company.
segments.cn: 所以我想你可以把它应用到公司上。

segments.en: You say that a company has a positive outlook.
segments.cn: 你说一个公司有积极的运势。

segments.en: Or even a person.
segments.cn: 或者甚至一个人。

segments.en: You know, he's a very positive person, so he has a positive outlook.
segments.cn: 你知道，他是一个非常积极的人，所以他有积极的运势。

segments.en: He thinks good things are going to happen.
segments.cn: 他认为好事会发生。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So talking about horoscopes, obviously we must mention the 12 zodiac signs.
segments.cn: 所以谈到星座，显然我们必须提到12个星座。

segments.en: Okay, so each month has its own sign.
segments.cn: 好吧，每个月都有自己的星座。

segments.en: And they're not exactly the months.
segments.cn: 它们并不完全是月份。

segments.en: They're a symbol.
segments.cn: 它们是一个符号。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So for example, a lot of August is part of the Leo sign in English.
segments.cn: 例如，8月大部分时间属于狮子座。

segments.en: So that's the lion.
segments.cn: 所以那是狮子。

segments.en: And so the lion is the animal, the zodiac.
segments.cn: 狮子是动物，星座。

segments.en: So the zodiac sign is one of these signs.
segments.cn: 所以星座是这些星座之一。

segments.en: Like Leo is one of the zodiac signs.
segments.cn: 比如狮子是星座之一。

segments.en: And I guess the all 12 signs are considered the zodiac or the horoscope.
segments.cn: 我想所有12个星座都被认为是星座或运势。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And you can actually talk about the zodiac in terms of other cultures.
segments.cn: 你实际上可以在其他文化中谈论星座。

segments.en: There is a Chinese zodiac.
segments.cn: 有中国的星座。

segments.en: So we could say it's the year of the horse.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说这是马年。

segments.en: But that's a little bit different from what we're talking about here with the Western horoscope.
segments.cn: 但这与我们在这里谈论的西方运势有点不同。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So all of this actually comes down to the, as we say, the pseudoscience or the branch called astrology.
segments.cn: 所以这一切实际上归结为，正如我们所说的，伪科学或称为占星术的分支。

segments.en: Astrology.
segments.cn: 占星术。

segments.en: So this is a very hard word for some people to remember because they want to say astronomy.
segments.cn: 这是一个对某些人来说很难记住的词，因为他们想说天文学。

segments.en: But it's different.
segments.cn: 但这是不同的。

segments.en: Astronomy is the scientific study of the skies, the stars, planets, things like that.
segments.cn: 天文学是对天空、星星、行星等的科学研究。

segments.en: Astrology is different.
segments.cn: 占星术是不同的。

segments.en: It's what we're talking about here, the horoscope, and reading the stars to understand what our personal futures will hold for us.
segments.cn: 这是我们在这里谈论的，运势，以及阅读星星以了解我们的个人未来将会发生什么。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So astronomy is an exact science part of, I guess, physics where you talk about the stars or the composition of the stars and their movements.
segments.cn: 所以天文学是一个精确的科学，属于我想是物理学的一部分，谈论星星或星星的组成及其运动。

segments.en: Whereas in astrology we're talking about zodiacs and horoscopes and basically what star was in the sky when you were born, but in a different way.
segments.cn: 而在占星术中，我们谈论的是星座和运势，基本上是你出生时天空中的星星，但以不同的方式。

segments.en: It's not very scientific.
segments.cn: 这并不是很科学。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So astrology is normally what you would see in the newspaper when you're trying to find your horoscope, astrology or horoscope.
segments.cn: 所以占星术通常是你在报纸上看到的，当你试图找到你的运势时，占星术或运势。

segments.en: And actually every time you read the newspaper, if you look up your zodiac sign, it makes a prediction about your day or your week or maybe even sometimes a month or year.
segments.cn: 实际上每次你阅读报纸时，如果你查找你的星座，它会对你的一天、一周，甚至有时一个月或一年做出预测。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And so a prediction is basically a guess about what will happen for you.
segments.cn: 所以预测基本上是对你将会发生什么的猜测。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So many times you see that the horoscope will say, finances are in trouble.
segments.cn: 所以很多时候你会看到运势说，财务有麻烦。

segments.en: Be careful with how you spend your money.
segments.cn: 小心你的花费。

segments.en: So they're making a prediction that in the future maybe you're going to have money problems, so you have to be careful.
segments.cn: 所以他们在预测未来你可能会有经济问题，所以你必须小心。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Or in the dialogue, you will have a passionate summer fling.
segments.cn: 或者在对话中，你会有一个热情的夏季恋情。

segments.en: This is a prediction.
segments.cn: 这是一个预测。

segments.en: It has not yet happened.
segments.cn: 这还没有发生。

segments.en: It will happen.
segments.cn: 它会发生。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: A prediction.
segments.cn: 一个预测。

segments.en: So now talking a little bit more about the zodiac signs that we saw in the dialogue, we mentioned two, Aries and Capricorn.
segments.cn: 现在再谈谈我们在对话中看到的星座，我们提到了两个，白羊座和摩羯座。

segments.en: So a lot of people who believe in astrology say that astrological signs are broken up.
segments.cn: 很多人相信占星术，认为星座是分开的。

segments.en: They're divided into different kinds of sign.
segments.cn: 它们被分为不同类型的星座。

segments.en: We have water signs, air signs, earth signs and fire signs.
segments.cn: 我们有水象星座、风象星座、土象星座和火象星座。

segments.en: One of the famous fire signs is Aries, right?
segments.cn: 著名的火象星座之一是白羊座，对吧？

segments.en: Aries.
segments.cn: 白羊座。

segments.en: It's like the god of war in the Greek mythology.
segments.cn: 它就像希腊神话中的战神。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And so it's pronounced Aries, Aries.
segments.cn: 所以它的发音是白羊座，白羊座。

segments.en: A-R-I-E-S.
segments.cn: A-R-I-E-S。

segments.en: Aries.
segments.cn: 白羊座。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And the other one is a Capricorn.
segments.cn: 另一个是摩羯座。

segments.en: Capricorn.
segments.cn: 摩羯座。

segments.en: So that's like a goat?
segments.cn: 那是像山羊吗？

segments.en: Yeah, it's kind of like a ram.
segments.cn: 是的，有点像公羊。

segments.en: A ram.
segments.cn: 一只公羊。

segments.en: It's like an earth sign.
segments.cn: 它是一个土象星座。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So there are 12.
segments.cn: 所以一共有12个。

segments.en: These are just two of them.
segments.cn: 这只是其中两个。

segments.en: And obviously there are a lot more.
segments.cn: 显然还有很多。

segments.en: I guess off the top of my head, we have Taurus or Leo.
segments.cn: 我想起的有金牛座或狮子座。

segments.en: There's also a Scorpio.
segments.cn: 还有天蝎座。

segments.en: Sagittarius.
segments.cn: 射手座。

segments.en: Sagittarius.
segments.cn: 射手座。

segments.en: Gemini.
segments.cn: 双子座。

segments.en: Gemini, which are like twins, twin people.
segments.cn: 双子座，就像双胞胎，双胞胎的人。

segments.en: There's Pisces.
segments.cn: 还有双鱼座。

segments.en: Virgo.
segments.cn: 处女座。

segments.en: And Virgo the Virgin.
segments.cn: 还有处女座。

segments.en: And I don't know if we're missing anything.
segments.cn: 我不知道我们是否遗漏了什么。

segments.en: I can't think now.
segments.cn: 我现在想不起来。

segments.en: We'll have to talk about it at the very end of today's lesson.
segments.cn: 我们得在今天课程的最后谈谈这个。

segments.en: But we actually have some interesting things to talk about in a minute here.
segments.cn: 但我们实际上有一些有趣的事情要在这里讨论。

segments.en: We have to talk about the personality characteristics that are common when you're talking about different zodiac signs.
segments.cn: 我们必须谈谈不同星座的共同个性特征。

segments.en: Okay, so before we get to that, let's listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 好的，在我们谈到这个之前，让我们再听一遍我们的对话。

segments.en: Hey, Lydia, what are you reading?
segments.cn: 嘿，莉迪亚，你在读什么？

segments.en: I'm looking at my horoscope for this month.
segments.cn: 我在看这个月的星座运势。

segments.en: My outlook is very positive.
segments.cn: 我的前景非常积极。

segments.en: It says that I should take a vacation to some place exotic and that I will have a passionate summer fling.
segments.cn: 它说我应该去一个异国情调的地方度假，并且我会有一个热情的夏季恋情。

segments.en: What are you talking about?
segments.cn: 你在说什么？

segments.en: Let me see that.
segments.cn: 让我看看。

segments.en: What are horoscopes?
segments.cn: 什么是星座运势？

segments.en: It's a prediction of your month based on your zodiac sign.
segments.cn: 它是根据你的星座对你这个月的预测。

segments.en: You have a different sign for the month and date you were born in.
segments.cn: 你有一个不同的星座，取决于你出生的月份和日期。

segments.en: I was born on April 15th, so I'm an Aries.
segments.cn: 我出生在4月15日，所以我是白羊座。

segments.en: When were you born?
segments.cn: 你什么时候出生？

segments.en: January 5th.
segments.cn: 1月5日。

segments.en: Let's see.
segments.cn: 让我看看。

segments.en: You're a Capricorn.
segments.cn: 你是摩羯座。

segments.en: It says that you'll be feeling stress at work, but you could see new exciting developments in your love life.
segments.cn: 它说你会感到工作压力，但你可能会在爱情生活中看到新的令人兴奋的发展。

segments.en: Looks like we'll both have interesting summers.
segments.cn: 看起来我们两个都会有有趣的夏天。

segments.en: That's bogus.
segments.cn: 这太荒谬了。

segments.en: I don't feel any stress at work, and my love life is practically non-existent.
segments.cn: 我在工作中没有感到任何压力，我的爱情生活几乎不存在。

segments.en: This zodiac stuff is all a bunch of nonsense.
segments.cn: 这些星座的东西都是一堆胡说八道。

segments.en: No, it's not.
segments.cn: 不，不是的。

segments.en: Your astrology sign can tell you a lot about your personality.
segments.cn: 你的星座可以告诉你很多关于你个性的信息。

segments.en: See?
segments.cn: 看吧？

segments.en: It says that an Aries is energetic and loves to socialize.
segments.cn: 它说白羊座是充满活力并且喜欢社交的。

segments.en: Well, you certainly match those criteria, but they're so broad they could apply to anyone.
segments.cn: 嗯，你确实符合这些标准，但它们太宽泛了，适用于任何人。

segments.en: What does it say about me?
segments.cn: 它对我说了什么？

segments.en: A Capricorn is serious minded and practical.
segments.cn: 摩羯座是严肃和务实的。

segments.en: She likes to do things in conventional ways.
segments.cn: 她喜欢以传统的方式做事。

segments.en: That sounds just like you.
segments.cn: 听起来就像你。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at these personality traits on language takeaway part two.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看这些个性特征在语言收获第二部分。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言收获。

segments.en: All right, so one of the great words that we heard in today's dialogue was exotic, okay?
segments.cn: 好的，今天对话中我们听到的一个很棒的词是异国情调的，对吧？

segments.en: And this is not necessarily describing a person, but usually things or clothes or places.
segments.cn: 这并不一定是描述一个人，而通常是指事物、衣服或地方。

segments.en: And in this instance, it was some place exotic.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，它是一个异国情调的地方。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: What's an exotic place?
segments.cn: 什么是异国情调的地方？

segments.en: It's basically a place that's very unique, and I guess it's kind of not common to go there or to find.
segments.cn: 基本上是一个非常独特的地方，我想去那里或找到那里的人并不常见。

segments.en: For example, many people talk about an exotic getaway going to the jungle, because it's so exotic.
segments.cn: 例如，很多人谈论去丛林的异国情调的度假，因为它是如此异国情调。

segments.en: You have so many strange animals and plants and everything is so unfamiliar.
segments.cn: 你有很多奇怪的动物和植物，一切都如此陌生。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So in my mind, Tahiti is very exotic.
segments.cn: 所以在我看来，塔希提是非常异国情调的。

segments.en: All right, it's full of jungle and there's also beaches, and it's very unusual for someone who's from America because it's just so far away.
segments.cn: 好吧，那里满是丛林，还有海滩，对于来自美国的人来说非常不寻常，因为它实在太远了。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Exotic.
segments.cn: 异国情调。

segments.en: So someone can also have an exotic personality because maybe they're a little bit strange, or not strange, but not so common, maybe unique.
segments.cn: 所以一个人也可以有异国情调的个性，因为他们可能有点奇怪，或者不奇怪，但不那么常见，可能是独特的。

segments.en: Yeah, although exotic is usually kind of a sexy thing when you're talking about people.
segments.cn: 是的，尽管当你谈论人时，异国情调通常是有点性感的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: She looks very exotic.
segments.cn: 她看起来非常异国情调。

segments.en: That means she doesn't look like everybody else here.
segments.cn: 这意味着她看起来和这里的每个人都不一样。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: But another adjective to describe someone's personality is somebody that's very energetic.
segments.cn: 但描述某人个性的另一个形容词是非常充满活力的。

segments.en: All right, so energetic sounds like the word energy.
segments.cn: 好吧，充满活力听起来像是能量这个词。

segments.en: That's because they're related.
segments.cn: 这是因为它们是相关的。

segments.en: And so someone who is energetic has lots of energy.
segments.cn: 所以一个充满活力的人有很多能量。

segments.en: He or she likes to do a lot of things and wants to always go places.
segments.cn: 他或她喜欢做很多事情，并且总是想去不同的地方。

segments.en: And you know the energetic person at your office.
segments.cn: 你知道你办公室里的那个有活力的人。

segments.en: They always drink coffee.
segments.cn: 他们总是喝咖啡。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Maybe they make everyone else really tired just listening to them.
segments.cn: 也许光是听他们说话就让其他人感到疲惫。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And actually a person that's energetic usually also loves to socialize.
segments.cn: 其实一个有活力的人通常也喜欢社交。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So loves to means they like to, but they like it a lot, right?
segments.cn: 所以喜欢社交意味着他们很喜欢，但非常喜欢，对吧？

segments.en: But to socialize means to talk to other people or to go to parties or to meet new people.
segments.cn: 但社交意味着与其他人交谈，参加聚会或结识新朋友。

segments.en: So if it's a verb, to socialize means to talk to people, to meet people, to greet people.
segments.cn: 所以如果是动词，社交意味着与人交谈，见面，问候。

segments.en: You love to have contact with other people.
segments.cn: 你喜欢与其他人接触。

segments.en: So yeah, you're right.
segments.cn: 所以是的，你说得对。

segments.en: Very, very common for people who are energetic.
segments.cn: 对于有活力的人来说，这非常常见。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And what about someone that's practical?
segments.cn: 那么，实用的人呢？

segments.en: What is that like?
segments.cn: 那是什么样的？

segments.en: Someone who is practical does a lot of things.
segments.cn: 实用的人做很多事情。

segments.en: Maybe someone who's practical always comes to their activities prepared.
segments.cn: 也许实用的人总是为他们的活动做好准备。

segments.en: So in my car, I'm very practical.
segments.cn: 所以在我的车里，我非常实用。

segments.en: I have extra water and a spare tire.
segments.cn: 我有额外的水和一个备用轮胎。

segments.en: But you can also say, I'm a very practical person.
segments.cn: 但你也可以说，我是一个非常实用的人。

segments.en: I like to do things that I can achieve as opposed to someone who always wants to do things that they can't really achieve.
segments.cn: 我喜欢做我能实现的事情，而不是总想做那些我无法实现的事情。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So a practical person is usually very realistic and very down to earth.
segments.cn: 所以一个实用的人通常非常现实，非常脚踏实地。

segments.en: Maybe someone that's practical, if they're going on a trip, they'll only take what's necessary, not more than they need.
segments.cn: 也许实用的人如果去旅行，他们只会带必要的东西，而不是超过他们需要的。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 是的，正是如此。

segments.en: Let me give you a good example.
segments.cn: 让我给你一个好例子。

segments.en: I like to go hiking.
segments.cn: 我喜欢徒步旅行。

segments.en: And sometimes I see women who have not made very practical decisions about the shoes they wear.
segments.cn: 有时我看到一些女性在鞋子的选择上没有做出非常实用的决定。

segments.en: So I like to wear hiking boots.
segments.cn: 所以我喜欢穿登山靴。

segments.en: These are very practical.
segments.cn: 这些非常实用。

segments.en: Wearing high heels on a mountain is not very practical.
segments.cn: 在山上穿高跟鞋并不是很实用。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: Now, we also mentioned that a Capricorn is serious minded and conventional in many ways.
segments.cn: 现在，我们还提到过摩羯座在许多方面是严肃和传统的。

segments.en: Someone who's serious minded maybe doesn't like to have fun and go out and do things that are silly.
segments.cn: 一个严肃的人可能不喜欢玩乐，不喜欢外出做傻事。

segments.en: Someone who's serious minded is usually very practical, I think, and really has a goal, wants to achieve that goal.
segments.cn: 我认为一个严肃的人通常非常实用，并且真的有一个目标，想要实现那个目标。

segments.en: No time to be silly, no time to make jokes.
segments.cn: 没时间去傻笑，没时间开玩笑。

segments.en: So it doesn't necessarily mean that the person is boring, but they're just very, as you said, practical.
segments.cn: 所以这并不一定意味着这个人无聊，但他们确实非常，正如你所说，实用。

segments.en: And what about that a Capricorn also likes to do things in conventional ways?
segments.cn: 那么摩羯座也喜欢以传统的方式做事情呢？

segments.en: All right, so doing something in a conventional way means that you're doing it in a traditional way.
segments.cn: 好的，所以以传统的方式做某事意味着你以传统的方式去做。

segments.en: So this is a thing we've always done.
segments.cn: 这是一件我们一直以来都这样做的事情。

segments.en: We've always done it in this way, and I'm going to continue to do it in this way.
segments.cn: 我们一直以这种方式做，我将继续以这种方式做。

segments.en: So the opposite is unconventional.
segments.cn: 所以相反的是非传统的。

segments.en: That means doing things in new ways, doing things with your imagination.
segments.cn: 这意味着以新的方式做事情，运用你的想象力做事情。

segments.en: And so something that's very conventional is something that has been established, and we're just going to continue doing it that way.
segments.cn: 所以非常传统的事情是已经建立的事情，我们将继续以这种方式做。

segments.en: So for example, someone that gets married in a church is the conventional way, but someone that gets married while skydiving is very unconventional.
segments.cn: 例如，在教堂结婚是传统的方式，但在跳伞时结婚是非常非传统的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Unconventional.
segments.cn: 非传统。

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对正确。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So a lot of great vocab here.
segments.cn: 所以这里有很多很棒的词汇。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue one last time, and we'll be back to talk with you a little bit more.
segments.cn: 我们再听一遍对话，然后我们会回来和你聊更多。

segments.en: Hey, Lydia, what are you reading?
segments.cn: 嘿，莉迪亚，你在读什么？

segments.en: I'm looking at my horoscope for this month.
segments.cn: 我在看这个月的星座运势。

segments.en: My outlook is very positive.
segments.cn: 我的前景非常积极。

segments.en: It says that I should take a vacation to someplace exotic and that I will have a passionate summer fling.
segments.cn: 说我应该去一个异国情调的地方度假，并且我会有一个热情的夏季恋情。

segments.en: What are you talking about?
segments.cn: 你在说什么？

segments.en: Let me see that.
segments.cn: 让我看看。

segments.en: What are horoscopes?
segments.cn: 星座是什么？

segments.en: It's a prediction of your month based on your zodiac sign.
segments.cn: 这是根据你的星座对你这个月的预测。

segments.en: You have a different sign for the month and date you were born in.
segments.cn: 你有一个不同的星座，取决于你出生的月份和日期。

segments.en: I was born on April 15th, so I'm an Aries.
segments.cn: 我是4月15日出生，所以我是白羊座。

segments.en: When were you born?
segments.cn: 你什么时候出生？

segments.en: January 5th.
segments.cn: 1月5日。

segments.en: Let's see.
segments.cn: 让我看看。

segments.en: You're a Capricorn.
segments.cn: 你是摩羯座。

segments.en: It says that you will be feeling stress at work, but you could see new exciting developments in your love life.
segments.cn: 说你在工作中会感到压力，但在你的爱情生活中可能会看到新的令人兴奋的发展。

segments.en: Looks like we'll both have interesting summers.
segments.cn: 看来我们两个的夏天都会很有趣。

segments.en: That's bogus.
segments.cn: 这太荒谬了。

segments.en: I don't feel any stress at work, and my love life is practically non-existent.
segments.cn: 我在工作中没有感到任何压力，而我的爱情生活几乎不存在。

segments.en: This zodiac stuff is all a bunch of nonsense.
segments.cn: 这些星座的东西都是一堆胡说八道。

segments.en: No, it's not.
segments.cn: 不，不是的。

segments.en: Your astrology sign can tell you a lot about your personality.
segments.cn: 你的星座可以告诉你很多关于你个性的信息。

segments.en: See, it says that an Aries is energetic and loves to socialize.
segments.cn: 看，它说白羊座是有活力的，喜欢社交。

segments.en: Well, you certainly match those criteria, but they're so broad they could apply to anyone.
segments.cn: 嗯，你确实符合这些标准，但它们太宽泛了，可以适用于任何人。

segments.en: What does it say about me?
segments.cn: 它对我说了什么？

segments.en: A Capricorn is serious-minded and practical.
segments.cn: 摩羯座是严肃和实用的。

segments.en: She likes to do things in conventional ways.
segments.cn: 她喜欢以传统的方式做事情。

segments.en: That sounds just like you.
segments.cn: 听起来就像你。

segments.en: All right, so talk about the horoscopes.
segments.cn: 好吧，那就谈谈星座。

segments.en: Which sign are you?
segments.cn: 你是什么星座？

segments.en: I'm a Leo, which is actually... I don't believe in the horoscope, but I have to say, every time someone tells me about Leos... Leo the lion, right?
segments.cn: 我是狮子座，实际上... 我不相信星座，但我得说，每次有人告诉我关于狮子座的事情... 狮子，没错？

segments.en: I agree with most of their descriptions of my personality.
segments.cn: 我同意他们对我个性的描述中的大部分。

segments.en: So, outspoken.
segments.cn: 所以，直言不讳。

segments.en: Loves to socialize.
segments.cn: 喜欢社交。

segments.en: Very opinionated, which means I have an opinion, and I don't like to listen to other people.
segments.cn: 非常有主见，这意味着我有自己的看法，不喜欢听别人说。

segments.en: Loves to argue very loud.
segments.cn: 喜欢大声争论。

segments.en: So, these are all qualities that I think I have, and some of them are bad, some of them are good, but you know, that's the way it is.
segments.cn: 所以，这些都是我认为我有的品质，其中一些是坏的，有些是好的，但你知道，这就是现实。

segments.en: So, but you don't really believe in what magazines or newspapers say about your outlook?
segments.cn: 但是你真的不相信杂志或报纸对你前景的说法吗？

segments.en: Nah, I don't... Yeah, the predictions are usually just basic guesses.
segments.cn: 不，我不... 是的，预测通常只是基本的猜测。

segments.en: But what about you?
segments.cn: 但你呢？

segments.en: What's your sign?
segments.cn: 你的星座是什么？

segments.en: I am a Taurus, so I was born in May.
segments.cn: 我是金牛座，所以我五月出生。

segments.en: A bull.
segments.cn: 一头牛。

segments.en: A bull, yes.
segments.cn: 是的，一头牛。

segments.en: So, I'm very stubborn and very strong.
segments.cn: 所以，我非常固执且很强壮。

segments.en: I don't really know what all the characteristics about the Taurus are.
segments.cn: 我其实不太了解金牛座的所有特征。

segments.en: Opinionated.
segments.cn: 有主见。

segments.en: I know that it's stubborn.
segments.cn: 我知道它很固执。

segments.en: Loves to argue.
segments.cn: 喜欢争论。

segments.en: Doesn't like to be corrected.
segments.cn: 不喜欢被纠正。

segments.en: Are you describing Taurus or are you describing me?
segments.cn: 你是在描述金牛座还是在描述我？

segments.en: Both.
segments.cn: 两者都是。

segments.en: All right, so it's actually very interesting.
segments.cn: 好吧，这其实很有趣。

segments.en: I think in many ways, sometimes the glove does fit, and someone's zodiac sign describes them very well.
segments.cn: 我认为在很多方面，有时这个描述确实适合，有些人的星座非常符合他们。

segments.en: But again, maybe like the dialogue says, they are very broad descriptions that basically any person can relate to.
segments.cn: 但再说一次，也许就像对话所说的，它们是非常宽泛的描述，基本上任何人都能关联。

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对如此。

segments.en: I think that that's one of the tricks to horoscopes or to predicting someone's future.
segments.cn: 我认为这就是星座或预测某人未来的一个技巧。

segments.en: You tell them enough very vague things that maybe some of them will fit and some of them won't.
segments.cn: 你告诉他们足够多的模糊信息，也许其中一些会适合，有些则不会。

segments.en: But I'm very curious to hear about you guys.
segments.cn: 但我很想听听你们的情况。

segments.en: What are your signs?
segments.cn: 你们的星座是什么？

segments.en: What's your sign?
segments.cn: 你的星座是什么？

segments.en: That means what's your zodiac sign?
segments.cn: 这意味着你的星座是什么？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: That's actually also a very common date question.
segments.cn: 这实际上也是一个非常常见的约会问题。

segments.en: People say, oh, what's your sign?
segments.cn: 人们会说，哦，你的星座是什么？

segments.en: Or a pickup line.
segments.cn: 或者是搭讪的台词。

segments.en: Or a pickup line.
segments.cn: 或者是搭讪的台词。

segments.en: Hey, baby, what's your sign?
segments.cn: 嘿，宝贝，你的星座是什么？

segments.en: To see if you're compatible, right?
segments.cn: 看看你们是否合适，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So let us know.
segments.cn: 所以告诉我们。

segments.en: We're not trying to pick you up.
segments.cn: 我们不是想搭讪你。

segments.en: We're just curious.
segments.cn: 我们只是好奇。

segments.en: You'll find a lot of the words for the zodiac in today's lesson on our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 你会在我们的网站 EnglishPod.com 的今天课程中找到很多关于星座的词汇。

segments.en: All right, we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
